zone_pwm.title: PWM Advanced Settings
zone_pwm.description:
Configure PWM (Pulse Width Modulation) parameters for proportional heating control.

üí° **Recommended defaults** work well for most cases.

**What is PWM?**
PWM cycles the heating ON and OFF in short intervals. Instead of fully heating until target, it adjusts the ON/OFF ratio based on how far you are from target temperature.

**Parameters explained:**
‚Ä¢ **Cycle Time**: Full PWM period (ON + OFF time)
‚Ä¢ **Min ON/OFF Time**: Safety minimums to avoid rapid switching
‚Ä¢ **Kp (Proportional)**: How aggressively to heat (higher = more aggressive)
‚Ä¢ **Ki (Integral)**: Eliminates steady-state error over time

data_description.pwm_cycle_time: 5-30 minutes (default: 15). Shorter = faster response, longer = more stable
data_description.pwm_min_on_time: 1-10 minutes (default: 3). Prevents very short heating bursts
data_description.pwm_min_off_time: 1-10 minutes (default: 3). Prevents very short cooling periods
data_description.pwm_ki: 0-10 (default: 2). Higher = faster elimination of temperature offset
